intro: Erysimum helveticum, commonly known as the Swiss wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a low-growing herbaceous perennial that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often reddish in color. Its flowers are bright yellow, with four petals arranged in a cross shape, typical of the Brassicaceae family. Erysimum helveticum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments.
